Description: FLIR Systems, Inc. settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized exports of defense articles, including technical data; the unauthorized provision of defense services; violation of the terms of provisos or other limitations of license authorizations; and the failure to maintain specific records involving ITAR-controlled transactions. FLIR's alleged unauthorized exports also included the retransfer of ITAR-controlled technical data and provision of defense services to dual-national employees of Iran, Iraq, Lebanon, and Cuba to which the United States restricts exports of defense articles and defense services.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls
State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls
State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls
State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: Airbus SE settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with the provision of false statements on authorization requests; the failure to provide accurate and complete reporting on political contributions, commissions, or fees that it paid, or offered or agreed to pay, in connection with sales; the failure to maintain records involving ITAR-controlled transactions; and the unauthorized re-export and retransfer of defense articles. At around the same time, Airbus entered into a $527 million settlement with the Justice Department, which included a $5 million credit toward the DDTC penalty (see separate entry).
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: Honeywell International, Inc. settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized exports and retransfers of technical data resulting from the failure to exercise appropriate internal controls.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: Keysight Technologies, Inc. settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized exports of technical data, to include software, to various countries, including a proscribed destination.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: Torrey Pines Logic, Inc. settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized exports of defense articles to various countries, including proscribed destinations.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: 3D Systems Corporation settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized exports and retransfers of technical data to various countries, including a proscribed destination and the failure to maintain ITAR records.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls

Description: Island Pyrochemical Industries Corp. settled allegations that it violated the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) in connection with unauthorized brokering involving a corporation from the People's Republic of China, a proscribed country and false statements on license applications.
Agency: State Department Directorate of Defense Trade Controls
